IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE FRIENDS COUNCIL ON EDUCATION IS TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP IN DRAWING FRIENDS SCHOOLS TOGETHER IN UNITY OF SPIRIT AND COOPERATIVE ENDEAVORS. THE COUNCIL'S WORK NURTURES THE QUAKER LIFE OF SCHOOLS, STRENGTHENS THE NETWORK OF SUPPORT ACROSS SCHOOLS, PROMOTES FRIENDS EDUCATION THROUGH CONSULTATIONS, PROGRAMS AND PUBLICATIONS AND ASSISTS IN THE ESTABLISHMENT OF NEW FRIENDS SCHOOLS. THE COUNCIL HELPS FRIENDS SCHOOLS MAINTAIN THEIR QUAKER IDENTITY AND ETHOS, AND THEIR RELATIONSHIP WITH THE RELIGIOUS SOCIETY OF FRIENDS. THE COUNCIL PROMOTES PROFESSIONAL GROWTH FOR TRUSTEES, HEADS, ADMINSTRATORS AND FACULTY TO FURTHER THE GOALS OF QUAKER EDUCATION AND SERVES AS A VOICE FOR FRIENDS SCHOOLS IN THE NATIONAL DIALOGUE ON EDUCATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE FRIENDS COUNCIL ON EDUCATION IS TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP IN DRAWING FRIENDS SCHOOLS TOGETHER IN UNITY OF SPIRIT AND COOPERATIVE ENDEAVORS. THE COUNCIL'S WORK NURTURES THE QUAKER LIFE OF SCHOOLS, STRENGTHENS THE NETWORK OF SUPPORT ACROSS SCHOOLS, PROMOTES FRIENDS EDUCATION THROUGH CONSULTATIONS, PROGRAMS AND PUBLICATIONS AND ASSISTS IN THE ESTABLISHMENT OF NEW FRIENDS SCHOOLS. THE COUNCIL HELPS FRIENDS SCHOOLS MAINTAIN THEIR QUAKER IDENTITY AND ETHOS, AND THEIR RELATIONSHIP WITH THE RELIGIOUS SOCIETY OF FRIENDS. THE COUNCIL PROMOTES PROFESSIONAL GROWTH FOR TRUSTEES, HEADS, ADMINSTRATORS AND FACULTY TO FURTHER THE GOALS OF QUAKER EDUCATION AND SERVES AS A VOICE FOR FRIENDS SCHOOLS IN THE NATIONAL DIALOGUE ON EDUCATION.
IRS990.Desc: PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR FACULTY, ADMINISTRATORS, TRUSTEES AND STAFF OF FRIENDS SCHOOLS IN AREAS OF SCHOOL GOVERNANCE, PEACE EDUCATION, SERVICE LEARNING, COMMUNITY BUILDING, PROMOTING QUAKER VALUES AND TESTIMONIES IN SCHOOL LIFE AND DEVELOPING FUTURE LEADERS FOR FRIENDS SCHOOL.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: GRANTS TO SCHOOLS FOR FINANCIAL AID AND FOR CREATIVE STUDENT-CENTERED, VALUES-BASED PROJECTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PUBLICATION OF PAMPHLETS, BOOKS AND CURRICULA ON SCHOOL GOVERNANCE, PEACE EDUCATION, SERVICE LEARNING, COMMUNITY BUILDING AND PROMOTING QUAKER VALUES AND TESTIMONIES IN SCHOOL LIFE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COUNCIL IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER IRC SECTION 501(C)(3), THOUGH IT IS SUBJECT TO TAX ON INCOME UNRELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE, UNLESS THAT INCOME IS OTHERWISE EXCLUDED BY THE CODE. THE COUNCIL HAS PROCESSES PRESENTLY IN PLACE TO ENSURE THE MAINTENANCE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS; TO IDENTIFIY AND REPORT UNRELATED INCOME; TO DETERMINE ITS FILING AND TAX OBLIGATIONS; AND TO IDENTIFY AND EVALUATE OTHER MATTERS THAT MAY BE CONSIDERED TAX POSITIONS. THE COUNCIL HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE ARE NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GRANTS ARE FOR FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS TO ATTEND THE SCHOOLS THAT ARE AFFILIATED WITH THE FRIENDS COUNCIL ON EDUCATION. THE PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO THE SCHOOLS THAT THE STUDENTS ATTEND. FURTHER, SOME OF THE FUNDING IS USED TO SUPPORT STUDENT PROJECTS AT THE SCHOOLS.

THE MISSION OF THE FRIENDS COUNCIL ON EDUCATION IS TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP IN DRAWING FRIENDS SCHOOLS TOGETHER IN UNITY OF SPIRIT AND COOPERATIVE ENDEAVORS. THE COUNCIL'S WORK NURTURES THE QUAKER LIFE OF SCHOOLS, STRENGTHENS THE NETWORK OF SUPPORT ACROSS SCHOOLS, PROMOTES FRIENDS EDUCATION THROUGH CONSULTATIONS, PROGRAMS AND PUBLICATIONS AND ASSISTS IN THE ESTABLISHMENT OF NEW FRIENDS SCHOOLS. THE COUNCIL HELPS FRIENDS SCHOOLS MAINTAIN THEIR QUAKER IDENTITY AND ETHOS, AND THEIR RELATIONSHIP WITH THE RELIGIOUS SOCIETY OF FRIENDS. THE COUNCIL PROMOTES PROFESSIONAL GROWTH FOR TRUSTEES, HEADS, ADMINSTRATORS AND FACULTY TO FURTHER THE GOALS OF QUAKER EDUCATION AND SERVES AS A VOICE FOR FRIENDS SCHOOLS IN THE NATIONAL DIALOGUE ON EDUCATION.
THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND DIRECTOR OF FINANCE REVIEW THE FORM 990 AND APPROVE THE FINAL DRAFT. THE FINAL DRAFT IS CIRCULATED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE FILING.

CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE SIGNED ANNUALLY IN OCTOBER BY EACH BOARD MEMBER AND EMPLOYEE. SIGNED CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ARE KEPT ON FILE BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MONITORS COMPLIANCE.

THE EXECUTIVE COMITTEE SETS COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND KEY EMPLOYEES. EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS USE INFORMATION GATHERED REGARDING SALARIES AND BENEFITS FROM SEVERAL SOURCES: ASSOCIATIONS OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, QUAKER ORGANIZATIONS IN THE PHILADELPHIA AREA ADN NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN THE PHILADELPHIA AREA.

THE EXECUTIVE COMITTEE SETS COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND KEY EMPLOYEES. EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS USE INFORMATION GATHERED REGARDING SALARIES AND BENEFITS FROM SEVERAL SOURCES: ASSOCIATIONS OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, QUAKER ORGANIZATIONS IN THE PHILADELPHIA AREA ADN NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN THE PHILADELPHIA AREA.
THE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO ANYONE UPON REQUEST AND WILL BE POSTED ON THE WEBSITE.
